main: ^Known as the Santo Nino Festival is an annual religious and cultural festival in Cebu. The festival is nicknamed the "Grandest Festival in the Philippines." The festival is thought to be the first of the most well-known festivals in the Philippines.

c-0: ^It is held in celebration of one of the country’s most famous historic relics: the Santo Niño de Cebú. It comes from the Cebuano word “sulog” which means “like water current movement” which depicts the forward-backward step of Sinulog dance. It is celebrated to worship, praise, and give gratitude.
